subject: Re: [LSF/MM/BPF TOPIC] Where is fuse going? API cleanup, restructuring and more

reviews.author: Amir Goldstein
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Amir Goldstein, discussed various topics related to fuse, including API cleanup, restructuring, and phasing out unmaintained filesystems. He raised concerns about the challenges of verification and package maintenance when converting kernel/vfs APIs to userspace/low-level FUSE APIs.

reviews.author: Miklos Szeredi (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer Miklos Szeredi raised concerns about the maturity of the fuse design for BPF cross-track discussion and the feasibility of porting unmaintained kernel filesystems to a new framework, suggesting an alternative 'VFS emulator' library.

reviews.author: Jan Kara
reviews.summary: Reviewer Jan Kara expressed interest in the proposed API cleanup and restructuring effort, suggesting that it could be a good task for someone new to filesystem development work. He also provided input on which filesystems might be more suitable targets for this effort.

reviews.author: Luis Henriques
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Luis Henriques, expressed general agreement and enthusiasm for the proposed topics and API cleanup, but suggested merging a separate topic on restarting FUSE servers into this list.

reviews.author: John Groves
reviews.summary: Reviewer John Groves expressed interest in attending a session on fuse API cleanup, restructuring, and new features, but did not provide any technical feedback or concerns.

reviews.author: Joanne Koong
reviews.summary: Joanne Koong suggested two new items for discussion: leveraging io-uring multishot for batching fuse writeback and readahead requests, and settling how load distribution should be done for configurable queues.

reviews.author: Darrick Wong
reviews.summary: Reviewer Darrick Wong expressed concerns about the scope and complexity of the fuse-iomap patch, suggesting that it's too large for online discussion and would be better suited for in-person review at LSFMM.

reviews.author: Horst Birthelmer
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Horst Birthelmer, expressed interest in discussing the proposed changes and architectural shifts for FUSE, but did not provide any specific technical concerns or feedback.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised concerns about the patch bomb and requested clarification on the order of review, as well as suggested creating separate PRs for libfuse patches to avoid test failures.

reviews.author: Gao Xiang
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Gao Xiang, expressed concerns about the complexity and security of FUSE, suggesting that it should be a per-filesystem policy rather than an arbitrary one. They also mentioned that allowing unprivileged non-root-ns mounts for container users is useful but requires careful consideration.

reviews.author: John Groves
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised concerns about how the proposed API changes would affect existing code, specifically the dax_iomap_rw and dax_iomap_fault functions in the DAX layer.
